private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with vowels: A E I
I can only pick up or put down one top block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Help rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, K is on top of L, L is on top of M, M is on top of N, N is on the table

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only pick up or put down one top block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Help rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, K is on top of L, L is on top of M, M is on top of N, N is on the table

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the two agents to achieve the final stacked configuration where from top to bottom the blocks are A B C D E F G H I J K L M N with N on the table

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N
Both agents can only manipulate the top block of any stack and only one block at a time
One agent can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks and the other can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom B K F M L I top, Stack2 bottom G N D A top, Stack3 bottom E C H top, Stack4 bottom J top
The goal is a single stack with N on the table and M on N and L on M and K on L and J on K and I on J and H on I and G on H and F on G and E on F and D on E and C on D and B on C and A on B
The PDDL files should target the FastDownward planner

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating PDDL domain and problem files for the FastDownward planner. You must provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model block manipulation for the agent that handles vowel blocks only. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and predicates explicit and compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describe the portion of the task you can solve given your information. If you miss some information do not make assumptions, only describe what you can. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must be suitable for FastDownward.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating PDDL domain and problem files for the FastDownward planner. You must provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model block manipulation for the agent that handles consonant blocks only. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and predicates explicit and compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describe the portion of the task you can solve given your information. If you miss some information do not make assumptions, only describe what you can. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must be suitable for FastDownward.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling for the FastDownward planner. You must integrate the PDDL domains and problems provided by the agents into a coherent multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Keep actions belonging to different agents distinct and preserve agent-specific constraints. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The resulting PDDL must be suitable for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents planning to solve a block stacking task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You must orchestrate them to solve the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind the PDDL from agents may be partial or contain naming differences. Integrate the PDDL responses preserving distinct actions for each agent and resolving naming ambiguities. Here is the first agent PDDL output: {pddl_vowel_agent} Here is the second agent PDDL output: {pddl_consonant_agent} Think step by step and provide a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that will allow FastDownward to produce a plan coordinating both agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
